title: TGI Fridays boss suspended for asking teen ‘would you rather watch your parents have sex, or join in?’ during job interview
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments A MAN walked out of a job interview at a TGI Friday’s restaurant in Derby after he claims he was asked “disgusting and sick” questions. 
The man, who does not want to be named, applied for a part-time role at the eatery at Derby’s Intu Centre but walked out after he claims he was asked whether he would rather watch his parents having sex for a year or join in for just the start. Alamy A man walked out of a job interview at a TGI Friday’s restaurant in Derby after he claims he was asked “disgusting and sick” questions 
The 18-year-old from Chellaston told the Derby Telegraph he was “absolutely gob-smacked”. 
He added: “I thought it was disgusting, sick and pathetic. I left the interview at that point.” 
A spokesman for TGI apologised for what happened and said a member of staff had been suspended. 
They added: “The questions posed during the interview with the candidate are absolutely not part of TGI Friday’s interview process and we were very disappointed to learn of this incident. 
“Immediate action was taken, with the person involved suspended. 
“We have apologised to the candidate for the experience and offered them the opportunity to re-interview with us, which we hope they will take up.” RELATED STORIES Theresa May gets another poll boost while Jeremy Corbyn is somehow even less popular SHORT CIRCUITED Killer robots WILL be regulated but you won't get a payout if they nick your job, say Euro MPs THE SUN SAYS Brits are suffering from immigrants taking their jobs for half the price QUAFF LIKE AN EGYPTIAN Don't forget the Egyptians built the Pyramids on beer & they did a top job, say the Thinking Drinkers Think your job stinks? From clearing sewage to sniffing armpits, these have to be the worst jobs in the whole world 
Earlier this week it was reported how a job-hopeful turned up drunk for an interview with a police force was arrested on the spot and given a road-ban . 
Andrew Jackson, 48, was hoping to land an IT management role role with Greater Manchester Police. 
But after staff smelled alcohol on his breath he was breathalysed and found to be over the drink-drive limit. Girl, 7, writes letter to Google CEO telling him she wants to work for him 
The interviewer said: “I asked if he had any trouble in finding us, as soon as he began to speak I could smell something on his breath which I was thought was stale alcohol. 
“He mentioned that he did have a little trouble in finding somewhere to park, which immediately raised concerns. 
“Shortly after he arrived in the small office, the smell of alcohol became overpowering.” 
At end of the end of interview at the force’s Sedgely Park training centre, the GMP employee made an excuse to leave the room and sought advice from a police officer on what to do next. 
He added: “I didn’t want the man returning to his vehicle, given the obvious smell of alcohol. I couldn’t live with myself if there had been a collision and someone ended up seriously hurt.”
